The book includes [[mesostic]]s on the names of various people. In the forward to ''X'', Cage writes that the volume's texts represent an attempt "to find a way of writing which comes from ideas, is not about them, but which produces them."<ref>{{cite book|last=Nicholls |first=David (ed.)|title=The Cambridge Companion to John Cage|year=2002|publisher=Cambridge Univ. Press|location=Cambridge [u.a.]|isbn=9780521789684|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=z-lmi-59ET0C&pg=PA91&lpg=PA91&dq=x+john+cage+mesostic&source=bl&ots=chRccWnT1a&sig=OO4M8FmOcuVo6OJffqzBBYKjbdk&hl=en&sa=X&ei=z13uT5rWC4T48wSaw_SGAg&ved=0CFUQ6AEwAzgK#v=onepage&q=x%20john%20cage%20mesostic&f=false|page=91}}</ref> The book contains the following works: * "Foreword" (1983) * "Writing for the Fourth Time through [[Finnegans Wake]]" (1983) * "'There is not much difference between the two.' (Suzuki Daisetz)." (1979) * "Toyama 1982" (1982) * "[[James Joyce]], [[Marcel Duchamp]], [[Erik Satie]]: An Alphabet" (1981–83) * "Another Song" (1981) * "Writing through the Cantos" (1983) * (untitled) (1979, also known as "Correction") * "B.W. 1916–1979" (1979, also known as "[[Ben Weber (composer)|Ben Weber]], 1916–1979") * "For her first exhibition with love" (1982) * "Diary: How to Improve the World (You Will Only Make Matters Worse)" (continued 1973–82) * "Wishful Thinking" (1983) * "Muoyce (Writing for the Fifth Time through Finnegans Wake)" (1982, also published earlier as "Muoyce") == See also == * [[List of compositions by John Cage]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{John Cage}} [[Category:1983 books]] [[Category:Essay collections]] {{essay-stub}}
